questions.question: What is the difference between 'public,' 'private,' and 'protected' access modifiers in React?
options: Public members can be accessed from anywhere, private members can only be accessed within the same class, and protected members can be accessed within the same package.
Public members can be accessed within the same package, private members can be accessed from anywhere, and protected members can only be accessed within the same class.
Public members can be accessed from anywhere, private members can only be accessed within the same package, and protected members can be accessed from anywhere.
Public members can only be accessed within the same class, private members can be accessed from anywhere, and protected members can be accessed within the same package.

questions.question: How does React handle multiple inheritance?
options: React supports multiple inheritance by allowing a class to inherit from multiple parent classes.
React doesn't support multiple inheritance directly, but it allows multiple interface implementation.
React doesn't support multiple inheritance at all.
React supports multiple inheritance by using the 'extends' keyword.

questions.question: Explain the purpose of the 'static' keyword in React.
options: The 'static' keyword is used to make a variable constant in React.
The 'static' keyword is used to declare a variable that belongs to the class rather than an instance of the class.
The 'static' keyword is used to specify that a method can be overridden by child classes.
The 'static' keyword is used to create an instance of a class.

questions.question: Describe the difference between an abstract class and an interface in React.
options: An abstract class can have method implementations, while an interface cannot.
An interface can have method implementations, while an abstract class cannot.

An interface can have fields, while an abstract class cannot.

options: The RVM is a React compiler that converts React code to machine code.
The RVM is a device that connects React developers with the internet.
The RVM is a runtime environment that executes React bytecode and makes React platform-independent.
The RVM is a tool for debugging React applications.

questions.question: How is exception handling implemented in React?

React uses loops to repeatedly execute code until an exception is resolved.
React automatically handles all exceptions without the need for specific code.

'equals()' is used to compare strings, while '==' is used to compare integers.

questions.question: Explain the concept of 'garbage collection' in React.
